intro: Restio penicillatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland fynbos vegetation. Restio penicillatus is adapted to Mediterranean climates with mild, wet winters and dry summers.
